titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Aaron Burr letters and documents, 1780-1950

publicationstmt.publisher: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

profiledesc.creation: EAD generated by archives.nypl.org on December 9, 2014

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: Aaron Burr (1756-1836) was a Revolutionary War soldier, lawyer, United States Senator, and third Vice-President of the United States. Collection consists of miscellaneous letters to and from Aaron Burr, and documents signed by him, 1780-1835, including a letter from his wife Theodosia Prevost Burr, 1786 August; Burr's manuscript map of the Bastrop Grant in Louisiana, enclosed with his letter of 21 Oct 1806 to William Wilkins; and collateral material about Aaron Burr, circa 1800-1950, including newspaper clippings, auction catalog clippings, and printed matter.

bioghist.p: Aaron Burr (1756-1836) was a Revolutionary War soldier, lawyer, United States Senator, and third Vice-President of the United States.

scopecontent.p: Collection consists of miscellaneous letters to and from Aaron Burr, and documents signed by him, 1780-1835, including a letter from his wife Theodosia Prevost Burr, 1786 August; Burr's manuscript map of the Bastrop Grant in Louisiana, enclosed with his letter of 21 Oct 1806 to William Wilkins; and collateral material about Aaron Burr, circa 1800-1950, including newspaper clippings, auction catalog clippings, and printed matter.

prefercite.p: Aaron Burr letters and documents, Manuscripts and Archives Division, The New York Public Library

bibliography.p: Selected materials available on microfilm in The Papers of Aaron Burr (Microfilming Corp. of America, 1977) and in Political Correspondence and Public Papers of Aaron Burr (Princeton University Press, 1983)
